text: Hello #NinjaArmy it’s Emily here.
Today I want to share with you one of the many crazy Japanese invention that I’ve discovered recently.
And that invention is ‘The Cupmen’ and no I don’t mean these noodles,
I mean little guy or as I should say woman.
Apparently she acts as a timer for your cup of instant noodles.
Not only does she keep the lid shut, she also changes color to white as the temperature of the paper rises.
Ad that lets you know three minutes has elapsed.
I think that is a really cool product that only someone in Japan could make.
It's so Japanese.
Waiting for my noodles to be ready is going to be so much fun.
I don’t usually eat a lot of instant noodles, but a few months ago when I was scouring through some blog pages,
I came across this little guy and i knew that I had to get it and test it out.
So, that is exactly what I'm gonna do today
I searched many many many  shops and many many many  places  for this and I could not find it anywhere.
In the end i had to order it on Amazon and it cost about 1000 Yen delivered,
and it came the next day. Amazon in Japan is AMAZING!
I’ve also purchased three different types of cup noodles.
I have the original cup noodle, curry flavored cup noodle and Pad Thai cup noodle.
I’ve never actually tried the original cup noodle, so that’s what I would like to try today.
Okay, so let's get our little cup woman ready
So they actually sell many different designs of these and this is the cheerful cupwoman.

It looks like she's made of rubber
and like she's pretty bendable.
So let's see how she fits on the cup.
Fffffflllllllyyyyyyyyy!
Okay i think it's done.
According to the picture only the stomach and the legs and the arms go white.
OMG the whole underneath is definitely a different color that's for sure.
I wonder how long it takes until it returns to blue again.
I had my doubts at first if this was actually going to work,

and I have been blown away so that's
great.

And it's just a really really handy thing to
have in your kitchen.
If you want to purchase one of these i will leave the link below to where i got mine from.
It's from Japan so you might have to pay for shipping.
I'm going to sit back, relax and enjoy my noodles now.
So that's all i have for you today. If you like this video and
and you want to see more crazy Japanese inventions please give it a huge thumbs up.
And let me know if you have crazy inventions from your home country in the comments below.
Thanks for watching and i will see you next time, BYE!
